title: Orbiting the Moon

children.value: Find the speed of a satellite in a circular orbit around the Moon, very near the Moon's surface. Give your answer to two decimal places.
What is the kinetic energy per unit mass of the satellite?

answer.value:
The kinetic energy per unit mass is
$\displaystyle \frac{1}{2}v^2=GM/2R=1.41\times 10^6\textrm{ J kg}^{-1} $

hints.value:
The radius of the Moon is 
$\quantity{1.74\times 10^6}{m}$
, the mass of the Moon is 
$\quantity{7.35\times 10^{22}}{kg}$
 and Newton's Gravitational Constant, 
$\valuedef{G}{6.67 \times 10^{-11}}{N\,  m\sup {2}\,  kg\sup {-2}}$
.

children.value:
The gravitational force $\vari{F_{A}}$ between the satellite and the Moon is in the inward radial direction and its magnitude is given by the equation

$\displaystyle F_ A=GMm/R^2 $

where $\vari{G}$ is the gravitational constant; $\vari{M}$ and $\vari{m}$ are the masses of the Moon and the satellite respectively; and $\vari{R}$ is the radius of the orbit.
